name: Semantic Emergence Threshold Axiom
intent: Specify when raw deviation becomes semantically meaningful in a system.
constraints: A deviation d \= δ(c) is meaningful iff it is detectable, influences future evolution, and participates in a scale map σ with non-trivial propagation.
Detectability: ∃ observable L: D \-\> R such that L(d) ≠ 0.
Influence: ∃ evolution E: C \-\> C such that E(c) ≠ E(c') whenever δ(c) ≠ δ(c').
Inheritance: ∃ scale map σ: D \-\> D with σ(d) ≠ 0 for meaningful d.
A system is above the semantic emergence threshold iff there exists a non-empty set M ⊆ D of meaningful deviations.
